page.title: 11The Endway.
page.content: Down the Endway there are some interesting groups of cottages. Numbers 7,9,11 are a terrace of cottages,the deeds of which go back to 1745. They have 2 rooms downstairs:1 leading off the living room was originally a pantry. There is a lean-to at the back and 2 rooms 1 leading off the other upstairs. There is another group of cottages which for many years were occupied by labourers. This terrace was locally known as Pot Hall because of the unusually large number of chimneys for 6 small dwellings. Each one has twin chimney stacks with double flues at the front and single at the back. The cottages are of red brick which could have been locally made. At one time one bread oven was used by all 6 cottages.
